page.title: 05Education in Edinburgh
page.content: Central Edinburgh contains a number of major{education}institutions:-the medical, law, arts and social science faculties of the{University}are situated in George Square; Heriot-Watt University has buildings in the Grassmarket; Edinburgh College of Art is in Lauriston Place, while Moray House College of Education is on Holyrood Road. All these institutions are within a mile of one another. The number of students in the area gives it a youthful, non-conformist appearance and contrasts with the greyer image of the many financial and commercial institutions in the area. Unusually for Scotland there are a number of{private schools}dating from the 17th and 18th centuries, e.g.Heriot's, originally founded by James VI's banker as a hospital for destitute children.
